questions.question: 1. Which of the following solutions will be transparent to a bright source of light?

explanations.a: soil and water will not be transparent to light and will show a tyndall effect.
explanations.b: sugar solution will be transparent to light and will not show a tyndall effect.
explanations.c: milk will not let light pass at all.
explanations.d: corn starch will also not show a tyndall effect.

questions.question: 2. What is the one property of a suspension that is different from a solution or a colloid?

answers.a: If left to rest,the particles of a suspension will settle down.
answers.b: The particles of a suspension reflect light.

explanations.a: particles of suspension settle down if left to rest.
explanations.b: both suspension and colloid show tyndall effect.
explanations.c: suspension is never clear while solution is.
explanations.d: suspension may or may not be colorless.

questions.question: 3. What happens if one stirs vigorously to dissolve soap powder in water?

answers.a: more soap powder can now be added to the mixture.
answers.b: the foam starts forming and floats above the water surface.
answers.c: bubbles start popping in the water.
answers.d: the soap powder and water separate out.

explanations.a: soap powder forms lather when stirred in water. This does not allow more soap to be added.
explanations.b: soap solution starts forming lather and floats above the water surface.
explanations.c: bubbles will start forming but they won't pop out due to stirring.
explanations.d: stirring cannot separate the contents of the soap solution.

questions.question: 4. When a white light beam is passed through a glass cube containing small dispersed particles, the cube appears either bluish or reddish when viewed from different directions. Why?

answers.b: the dispersed particles scatter light in different wavelengths from different angles.
answers.c: The cube absorbs all other colors from incoming radiations.
answers.d: the particles emit bluish or reddish light.

explanations.a: the manufacturing defects cannot produce this kind of effect.
explanations.b: the wavelength of light scattered due to the tyndall effect depends on angle, polarisations and other factors.
explanations.c: the cube or the particles show color due to scattering and not absorption.
explanations.d: the particles do not emit light but scatter it.
